lexUnit.name: at large.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: escaped or not yet captured.

sentence.text: The killer was still at large , and the activities of hungry rats , as well as the most terrible injuries , meant that the body had never been identified .
And , in spite of police demands that he give himself up and intensive searches , he was still at large .
It was clear , incredible as it may seem , that there was a criminal at large on Ward 4 â€¦
But tonight at the end of the eleven day trial , the two gunmen were still at large .
In El Salvador , the FMLN is trying to build a party and electoral apparatus in a climate where the killers of the past decade are still at large .
Four months later her killer is still at large and detectives are looking at the possibility that she may not have been his first victim
He sat down on the far side of the room and I caught only a brief view of him through the dancers , but it was undoubtedly Ralph Pike still at large .
` You do n't think that fellow Burrows could have done it ? " asked Frobisher. 'From what I gather , he 's still at large . "
something 's at large
He had been detained under section 37 of the Mental Health Act , and the order would have lapsed if he had remained at large for 28 days , unless there was fresh evidence of mental illness .
So long as the Old Pretender remained at large an invasion of England or Scotland continued to be an ever-present possibility .
One of the country 's vice-presidents , Mr Casimir Ionescu , said thousands of Securitate members waging a guerrilla campaign had given up , while hundreds remained at large .
Under Section 37 of Britain 's Mental Health Act , he would have been legally a free man if he had remained at large for another hour .
For two days she remained at large despite a posse of pupils carrying out an inch-by-inch search of the building .
Despite Wood 's assurances that Findley and McNall would be tried , they remained at large in the valley .
And , in spite of police demands that he give himself up and intensive searches , he was still at large .
Okudaira was still at large and was said to be a member of the Japanese Red Army underground group .
That decision was therefore flawed and the applicant was prima facie unlawfully at large .
A police officer formed the opinion that she was unlawfully at large and on the same day went to the patient 's home with other police and nurses .
She died because she took a short cut across waste ground even though she knew that the murderer was at large in that area .
He had been at large in occupied France and had quite a tough time of it , but at least he survived and came back to Baldersdale .
